 Associate Research Scientist - Department of Urology Yale University School of Medicine March 2012  –  February 2014  (2 years) ◦ Co-Founder and Inaugural Engineering Research Director for the Yale Center for Biomedical and Interventional Technology 
◦ Successfully raised funding support for a new medical device incubator on Yale campus, leveraging resources from the School of Engineering & Applied Sciences and Yale School of Medicine 
◦ Supported new projects and grant submissions on a wide variety of topics, ranging from Diagnostic Radiology, Biomedical Engineering, Orthopedic Surgery and Urology. 
◦ Developed a business and financial plan to establish a consortium of on-campus engineers, scientists and clinicians to address gaps in medical device (MedTech) research and development 
◦ Initiated grassroots efforts to work with and gain support from Yale School of Medicine (YSM), Yale School for Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS) and Yale School of Management (SOM) 
◦ Established new research projects opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and medical students in YSM and SEAS, translating engineering prototypes to clinical research 
◦ Industry outreach to establish new internship, fellowship and sponsored research relationships 
 
 
Lecturer – Mechanical Engineering – Yale School of Engineering & Applied Sciences (Fall 2013) 
◦ Co-developer and co-instructor of a new undergraduate course: MENG 404 – Medical Device Design and Innovation, an ABET elective course featured by Yale News and the New Haven Register. 
◦ Innovative curriculum bringing in four physician mentors from YSM to coach teams of 5 students on projects ranging from surgical tools, organ preservation systems, drug delivery devices and seizure monitor instruments. 
◦ Topics covered include: design thinking, ideation, prototyping, benchmarking, experimental design, regulatory affairs, pre-clinical and clinical testing, intellectual property, entrepreneurship 
◦ Follow-on from students after the end of the course include invention disclosures, abstract/paper submissions, grant submissions and student business competitions. Postdoc in the Division of General Surgery, UCLA Center for Advanced Surgical and Interventional Technology January 2011  –  February 2012  (1 year 2 months) ◦ Working in the Center for Advanced Surgical and Interventional Technology (CASIT), a joint research program between the UCLA School of Engineering and Applied Sciences and the School of Medicine 
◦ Coordinating teams of clinicians and engineers to develop new research projects and technologies, while also focused on translating existing bench-top devices to clinical trials and marketplace 
◦ Other research areas include: prosthetics, rehabilitation engineering, minimally invasive surgical tools, robotic surgery and ultrasound diagnostics & therapeutics Graduate Student Researcher in Biomedical Engineering UCLA September 2006  –  December 2010  (4 years 4 months) ◦ Developed a novel system to provide auxiliary sensory feedback system for persons with lower-limb sensory deficits; taking a research concept from inception to human clinical testing 
◦ Designed integrated system controller and apparatus to translate detected plantar pressures at the base of a prosthetic foot to a tactile feedback sensory mapping on the residual limb of a transtibial amputee 
◦ Refined silicone balloon actuator design to provide dynamic tactile feedback to the residual limb that resists sensory adaptation 
◦ Performed human clinical trials - biomechanical gait analysis with persons with transtibial amputation with collaborators at Naval Medical Center, San Diego 
◦ Mentor and research advisor to graduate, undergraduate and high-school students as part of the UCLA Center for Excellence in Engineering and Diversity (CEED) 
◦ Also worked on a variety of other projects including: haptic feedback for robotic surgery, a refreshable Braille display, astronaut extravehicular activity gloves and a torso-mounted balance assist system.
